laboratory_examinations.findings: DHEAS levels below the detection limit (<0.4 µmol/liter [147.4 ng per liter]) at two measurements (at 8 years and at 12 years).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The most sensitive assay at 12 years indicated DHEAS level at 0.27 µmol per liter (99.5 ng per liter), but still considered below normal range (1.4–10.4 µmol/liter).

laboratory_examinations.findings: At 8 years of age, DHEA level was 15.0 nmol per liter (4.3 μg per liter), near the upper limit of normal; at 12 years, it peaked at 20.0 nmol per liter during testing.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased from 20.0 nmol per liter at baseline to 43.0 nmol per liter at 60 minutes during the cosyntropin stimulation test.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Under normal levels for her age and sex, androstenedione was 4.1 nmol per liter at 8 years (normal range 0.14–2.4), and 27.0 nmol per liter at 12 years (upper limit >12.0).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Resulted in increased levels, indicating twice as high values at 12 years compared to 8 years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At 8 years, testosterone level was 1.2 nmol per liter (normal range 0.03–0.65); at 12 years, it was 2.1 nmol per liter (normal range 0.51–1.26).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Results show doubled testosterone levels at 12 years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Cortisol level was 140 nmol per liter at baseline, and rose to 650 nmol per liter after cosyntropin administration (>500 denotes elevated).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicates a rise in cortisol levels post-stimulation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At baseline (<0.2 U per liter) and 4.5 U per liter after gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) stimulation (<0.05–20.2 U per liter).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Demonstrated low baseline levels with a significant increase after stimulation, indicating possible activation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Baseline level was 0.7 U per liter (normal range <0.2–3.7); after GnRH stimulation, levels rose to 8.5 U per liter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Exhibited increased response to stimulation, indicating normal function.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At 8 years, it was 36 pmol per liter (normal range <18–52); at 12 years, it was significantly elevated to 220 pmol per liter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in estradiol levels over time signifies increasing ovarian activity.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased excretion of androsterone at 5376 μg in 24 hours (normal range 287 to 2215).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Results in an increased output of androgen metabolites.
